author: Special Correspondent
text:
A farmer, who had consumed poison near the Mumbai Mantralaya and was admitted to hospital, died after three days of treatment on Saturday. According to the Marine Drive police, the deceased has been identified as Madhav Kadam (27), a native of Nanded.

The police said that on March 23, Kadam reached the gates of the new administrative building of the Mantralaya in the afternoon and consumed a liquid from a bottle that he was carrying. He fell down to the ground, convulsing and frothing from his mouth. Police personnel posted at the spot rushed him to the GT Hospital, where he was admitted to the Intensive Care Unit.

“Kadam was under treatment for three days and died on Saturday morning,” said police.
title: Hospitalised farmer dies
